question: If Eliud Kipchoge could maintain his record-making marathon pace indefinitely, how many thousand hours would it take him to run the distance between the Earth and the Moon its closest approach? Please use the minimum perigee value on the Wikipedia page for the Moon when carrying out your calculation. Round your result to the nearest 1000 hours and do not use any comma separators if necessary.

trajectory.question: If Eliud Kipchoge could maintain his record-making marathon pace indefinitely, how many thousand hours would it take him to run the distance between the Earth and the Moon its closest approach? Please use the minimum perigee value on the Wikipedia page for the Moon when carrying out your calculation. Round your result to the nearest 1000 hours and do not use any comma separators if necessary.

   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon
   Site: en.wikipedia.org
   Summary: Analyses of the Moon's time-variable rotation suggest that it is at least partly molten. The pressure at the lunar core is estimated to be 5 GPa (49,000 atm).

   Site: en.wikipedia.org
   Summary: Elliptic shape. The orbit of the Moon has an eccentricity of 0.0549, with perigee and apogee distances of 363,300 km (225744 mi) and 405,507 km (251970 mi) ...

Lunar distance A lunar distance, 384,399 km (238,854 mi), is the Moon's average distance to Earth. The actual distance varies over the course of its orbit . The image compares the Moon's apparent size when it is nearest and farthest from Earth. General information Unit system astronomy Unit of distance Symbol LD, Δ ⊕ L {\textstyle \Delta _{\oplus L}} Conversions 1 LD in ... ... is equal to ... trajectory.actor_reasoning: I will compute the time in thousand hours at Kipchoge's marathon speed to cover the Moon's minimum perigee distance and round to the nearest 1000 hours.

- Use the Moon page minimum perigee: 356400 km.
- Kipchoge’s WR pace: 42.195 km in 2:01:09 = 2.0191667 h → speed ≈ 20.89723 km/h.
- Time = 356400 / 20.89723 ≈ 17055 h → rounded to nearest 1000 hours = 17000 h = 17 thousand hours.

FINAL ANSWER: 17

General information Unit system astronomy Unit of distance Symbol LD, Δ ⊕ L {\textstyle \Delta _{\oplus L}} Conversions 1 LD in ... ... is equal to ... SI base unit = 3.843 99 × 10 8 m Metric system = 384 399 km English units ≈ 238 8

messages.content: I need to confirm Eliud Kipchoge's official marathon world record time to compute his constant running speed.

Found 3 relevant web results:

1. 2022 Berlin Marathon - Wikipedia
   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_Berlin_Marathon
   Site: en.wikipedia.org
   Summary: Kenyan runner Eliud Kipchoge set a new marathon world record, winning the race with a time of 2:01:09, and beating the previous record, which he had set himself ...

2. Masters M35 marathon world record progression - Wikipedia
   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masters_M35_marathon_world_record_progression
   Site: en.wikipedia.org
   Summary: Kenyan Eliud Kipchoge, age 37 at the time, set a world record for men of 2:01:09 on September 25, 2022, at the 2022 Berlin Marathon.

3. Berlin Marathon - Wikipedia
   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berlin_Marathon
   Site: en.wikipedia.org
   Summary: Eliud Kipchoge running world record (2:01:09) at the 2022 Berlin Marathon. His 4th of record 5 wins. The Berlin Marathon was established in 1974 by Horst ...
messages.name: web_search

messages.content: I will compute the time in thousand hours at Kipchoge's marathon speed to cover the Moon's minimum perigee distance and round to the nearest 1000 hours.

- Use the Moon page minimum perigee: 356400 km.
- Kipchoge’s WR pace: 42.195 km in 2:01:09 = 2.0191667 h → speed ≈ 20.89723 km/h.
- Time = 356400 / 20.89723 ≈ 17055 h → rounded to nearest 1000 hours = 17000 h = 17 thousand hours.

FINAL ANSWER: 17
